Kim,

"Here's what is exciting about sharing ideas with others:
if you share a new idea with ten people, they get to hear
it once and you get to hear it ten times. "

- Jim Rohn, Speaker and Author

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Our Day Is Finally Here!
messages.msgSnippet: Back at ya ,  Kim Be well, Janis ... From: CloseKnitFamilyOf3 To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com Sent: Thursday, July 31, 2003 5:46 PM Subject:
messages.messageBody:
Back at ya', Kim

Be well,
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: CloseKnitFamilyOf3
To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, July 31, 2003 5:46 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-Discussion] Our Day Is Finally Here!


Our day has finally come! We're moving tomorrow. Christopher is the
only one that is not nervous, he's ready to go. It's amazing how much
he has changed since we found unschooling and joined this list. It's
amazing how much we as parents are changing....slowly<g>

Just wanted to say thank-you to everyone on the list for all of your
wisdom and interesting conversations. We're going to take a break now
and regroup as a family and hope to be back sometime late August.

One last thing before I do go and the subject gets old. I wanted to
apologize for posting a link to a RUL. For the part I was on there, I
did not see no dislike of this list or of Sandra. Had I known the
story or had seen what went on before, I would have never posted the
link that caused so much nonsense. I love this list and the people
here and would never want anything bad to be said about either. For
those that are still mailing me, putting blame on me for all of this
starting, please realize that I wouldn't be on RUL, defending Sandra
nor this list if I didn't feel so strongly about them, I just
wouldn't waste my time.

Have a nice summer everyone!

Kim

<< For

those that are still mailing me, putting blame on me for all of this

starting >>

YIKES!
I didn't think it was a bad thing.

In fact, right after you posted that here, I posted it on Always Learning
because someone asked about other lists.

If anyone from this list has been blaming Kim for anything, please don't.

I hope the move goes well, Kim!! We'll see you here when you're settled.

Sandra

messages.subject: Our Day Is Finally Here!
messages.msgSnippet: Our day has finally come! We re moving tomorrow. Christopher is the only one that is not nervous, he s ready to go. It s amazing how much he has changed since
messages.messageBody:
Our day has finally come! We're moving tomorrow. Christopher is the
only one that is not nervous, he's ready to go. It's amazing how much
he has changed since we found unschooling and joined this list. It's
amazing how much we as parents are changing....slowly<g>

Just wanted to say thank-you to everyone on the list for all of your
wisdom and interesting conversations. We're going to take a break now
and regroup as a family and hope to be back sometime late August.

One last thing before I do go and the subject gets old. I wanted to
apologize for posting a link to a RUL. For the part I was on there, I
did not see no dislike of this list or of Sandra. Had I known the
story or had seen what went on before, I would have never posted the
link that caused so much nonsense. I love this list and the people
here and would never want anything bad to be said about either. For
those that are still mailing me, putting blame on me for all of this
starting, please realize that I wouldn't be on RUL, defending Sandra
nor this list if I didn't feel so strongly about them, I just
wouldn't waste my time.

Have a nice summer everyone!

Kim
